concept.title: Step 3. Configure environment variables
concept.shortdesc: Configure your system environment to build and run OpenSSL. Follow the environment setup that applies to your operating system.

conbody.p: For all references to the Pivotal_GemFire_NativeClient_64bit_xxxx directory, replace 64bit with the appropriate architecture and xxxx with the actual four-digit product build number.

section.title: Bourne and Korn shells (sh, ksh, bash)
section.codeblock: % OPENSSL=<parent folder for OpenSSL binaries>; export OPENSSL % GFCPP=<path to installation, typically C:\Pivotal_GemFire_NativeClient_64bit_xxxx>; export GFCPP % LD_LIBRARY_PATH=$LD_LIBRARY_PATH:$GFCPP/lib:$GFCPP/ssl_libs:$OPENSSL/lib % export LD_LIBRARY_PATH % CLASSPATH=$GEMFIRE/lib/gfSecurityImpl.jar:$CLASSPATH

section.title: Windows
section.codeblock: > set GFCPP=<path to installation, typically C:\Pivotal_GemFire_NativeClient_32or64bit_xxxx> > set OPENSSL=<path to installed OpenSSL, typically C:\OpenSSL> > set PATH=<path to Java JDK or JRE>\bin;%GFCPP%\bin;%GFCPP%\ssl_libs;%OPENSSL%\bin;%PATH% > set CLASSPATH=<path to GemFire installation>\lib\gfSecurityImpl.jar;%CLASSPATH%
